description: Jennifer Lander, 30, a mechanical engineering student at Bournemouth University, was found dead in the bathroom of her halls of residence by a shocked friend.
title: Bournemouth student found dead left carbon monoxide notes
title_page: Bournemouth student found dead left carbon monoxide notes | Daily Mail Online
text:
Jennifer Lander left notes warning of carbon monoxide in the air after mixing a toxic cocktail of chemicals, an inquest heard
A student found dead in her bathroom left notes warning of carbon monoxide in the air after mixing a toxic cocktail of chemicals, an inquest has heard.
Jennifer Lander, who studied mechanical engineering at Bournemouth University, was found dead in the bathroom of her halls of residence by a shocked friend.
After reading the notes left by 30-year-old Miss Lander warning of high levels of the deadly gas, the friend left the dormitory building and raised the alarm.
The incident prompted students to be evacuated from the Talbot Campus at the university in the Dorset seaside town for several hours.
Fire crews wearing protective masks and suits rushed to address and later removed a bin containing potentially hazardous materials from the premises.
As well as the warning notes, Miss Lander left letters to friends and family members indicating that she intended to take her own life.
An inquest that was opened into her death heard she had mixed chemicals to create carbon monoxide in the property.
A post mortem examination initially recorded her cause of death as unascertained but further tests were carried out and carbon monoxide toxicity was recorded.
Miss Lander, a mechanical engineering student at Bournemouth University, was found dead in the bathroom of her halls of residence (pictured) by a shocked friend
Miss Lander, who was known as 'Jen' to her friends, had moved from Norton Fitzwarren near Taunton, Somerset, to study in Bournemouth last year.
She was living in Block 57 of the student village on Gillett Road at the time of her death on January 12 this year.
Following her death, her friend Andy Snook said he had known her through his local gym for about seven years.
Mr Snook last saw her in the gym about two weeks before her death while she was at home for the university's Christmas break.
The incident prompted students to be evacuated from the Talbot Campus on Gillett Road at the university in the Dorset seaside town for several hours
He said: 'I am devastated. She was always active in the gym and we went to Body Power shows together. She was a beautiful soul.
'She told me that she was excited to pass all her exams at Bournemouth University. She was a wonderful, kind and caring person, who was the life and soul of the party.'
The inquest was adjourned and a full hearing will take place on July 5.
For confidential support call the Samaritans on 116123 or visit a local Samaritans branch. See www.samaritans.org for details.
